TopicTitle: Cool slow-mo footage of an Atlas E launch failure

Articles.Content:
I found some really awesome slow motion footage of an Atlas E missile exploding at liftoff from Vandenberg Air Force Base. It was a test of the missile with a dummy warhead, as the video's description states.

<iframe width="480" height="270" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/I55LkRz3Gok?feature=oembed" frameborder="0" allowfullscreen="true"></iframe>

(video has no sound)

Absolutely breathtaking.

**Edited <time datetime="2015-03-29T23:57:26Z" title="03/29/2015 11:57  PM" data-short="9 yr">March 29, 2015</time> by mythbusters844**
This video is now being used every day in my space center to gain morale for my Kerbals.
Interesting how it surges then falters several times.

> 
> This video is now being used every day in my space center to gain morale for my Kerbals.

I think you're doing it wrong. ![:confused:](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_huh.gif)
I bet this is how the guys at NASA celebrate New Year's Eve.
